title: How to see how many videos I have watched on Youtube - Quora

response.answer_text: I do not think it’s possible. If I remember correctly, Youtube removed that feature when they changed the layout of the channels. It’s the sad truth. I’d love to know personally, but it’s not possible. Edit, 8th September 2018: This may not answer your question, and this is hella late, but Youtube (at least on Android) just added a feature where you can see how many hours you've watched Youtube, with timeframes going back to a week. You can't see how many videos, but it's still neat.

You can see your entire past video history on YouTube right from the first video you watched till now. It is recorded in the ‘watch history’ section of the history tab located at the bottom of the channel page. This history will be available for the videos which you watched when you were logged into your YouTube account. You can also access your past videos from the browser history tab. If more than one user has access to YouTube on same PC, then this might be a problem because the browser would overlap information from different accounts and be unable to differentiate the history of one user from another, unless they sign in strictly from their respective accounts.
